text:
When you execute the attached createtables.sql with the ant sql task,
the string data for field "passwd" to insert gets corrupted.
On the first INSERT line, all is ok, but the 2 to 5 INSERT is sent modified to 
the DBMS: A space is appended to the passwd strings.

A "SELECT * FROM mitarbeiter where passwd LIKE '% ';" returns
rows 2, 3, 4, and 5.

This is in both cases, if you set delimitertype="row", so that all gets one 
transaction, or if you don't set it.

I use Postgres as DBMS with the JDBC driver  jdbc7.1-1.2.jar.
creator: koeppe@rbg.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de
koeppe@rbg.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de
text:
Problem was a hidden '\d' character at the end of the input string,
i.e. INSERT INTO ... VALUES (...,'data\d',...) which gets
converted to a space, whereas the psql cmd line tool ignores it.
